newsitem.title: JAPAN: TOCOM may extend trading time for overseas players.
newsitem.headline: TOCOM may extend trading time for overseas players.

text.p: The Tokyo Commodity Exchange (TOCOM) said on Wednesday it is considering extending the trading time for precious metal, rubber and aluminium futures contracts.
The move is an attempt to obtain more orders from overseas participants, a TOCOM spokesman told reporters.
For rubber, TOCOM would consider extending the afternoon session, given the time difference between Tokyo and rubber producing countries in Southeast Asia, he said.
For precious metals and aluminium, the exchange would consider extending the trading time to allow for easier and more active arbitrage trade with the London Metal Exchange, he said.
"We'll hold internal discussions throughout this year, and we would like to introduce a new trading times as early as early next year," the TOCOM spokesman said.
